member_organisations:
We are both an organisation of networks and partnerships as well - as far as legal entities governed by a board- the natural persons referred to above  . 
We work with several hundred constituents individual people living with HIV at any time as well as with some 60 organisations of people living with HIV. 
within the EU region we work closely and partner with several other civil society health and justice organisations as well as with 6 (currently) national PLHIV organisation spread across the EU .
eu_initiatives:
The Directorate General Health and Food Safety (‘DG SANTE’) of the European group of experts  the EU HIV/AIDS, VIRAL HEPATITIS AND TUBERCULOSIS Civil Society Forum ("CSF"). This is a forum 
for informal consultation of the EU HIV/AIDS Think . 
We have participated in and been called to speak in giving expert testimony and witness to this group.
organisation_name: Global Network of People Living with HIV (GNP+)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership: The details of who we work and partner with cam be found on our website  www.gnpplus.net
goals__remit:
GNP+ is the global network for and by people living with HIV. We work to improve the quality of life of all people living with HIV. This means we advocate for, and support fair and equal access to treatment, care and support services for people living with HIV around the world. 
 
We are based in Amsterdam (NL) and Cape Town(SA)  
 
We operate through partnerships with individuals, organisations and networks on the local, national, regional, and global level. 
 
Involvement, Rights, Treatment 
 
As a rights-based organisation, emancipation and self-determination are our core principles. Over the past decade we have spoken with, interviewed and surveyed tens of thousands living with HIV, getting to know – again and again – the issues of crucial importance to the lives of people living with HIV: our involvement, rights and treatment. 
 
It is our vision that people living with HIV will only enjoy a better quality of life if we keep demanding it. We support and nurture a powerful and united worldwide social movement of people living with HIV. 
 
Specifically within the EU region we work with other organisations and individuals ( mostly but not exclusively) living with or representing PLHIV to further the mission and vision of the organisation - and ensure equitable access to to health and justice for all . This will include those often marginalised such as migrants, those from minority populations within a country, people from the LGBTI communities.
relevant_communication:
Within Europe we have worked with other organisations on issues of the legal and regulatory barriers to HIV testing treatment and care - http://legalbarriers.peoplewithhiveurope.org/index.php 
On issues of stigma and discrimination with other partners in the OptTest inititiative  - 
http://www.opttest.eu/ 
on researching and identifying the stigma and discrimination faced by people living with HIV - www.stigmaindex.org 
We also track laws as they affect the criminalisation of HIV non-disclosure, exposure, and transmission www.gnpplus.net/criminalisation
